intro: Strychnos milneredheadii, commonly known as the Milner's strychnos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
